impulses.description: If you load multiple impulse files using the .addImpulse method, they will be stored as Objects in this Array. Toggle between them with the toggleImpulse(id) method.

addImpulse(path,callback,errorCallback).description: Load and assign a new Impulse Response to the p5.Convolver. The impulse is added to the .impulses array. Previous impulses can be accessed with the .toggleImpulse(id) method.

setBPM(BPM,rampTime).description: Set the tempo for all parts in the score

sequence.description: Array of values to pass into the callback at each step of the phrase. Depending on the callback function's requirements, these values may be numbers, strings, or an object with multiple parameters. Zero (0) indicates a rest.

setBPM(BPM,[rampTime]).description: Set the tempo of this part, in Beats Per Minute.

getBPM().description: Returns the tempo, in Beats Per Minute, of this part.

start([time]).description: Start playback of this part. It will play through all of its phrases at a speed determined by setBPM.

loop([time]).description: Loop playback of this part. It will begin looping through all of its phrases at a speed determined by setBPM.

stop([time]).description: Stop the part and cue it to step 0. Playback will resume from the begining of the Part when it is played again.

pause(time).description: Pause the part. Playback will resume from the current step.

addPhrase(phrase).description: Add a p5.Phrase to this Part.

removePhrase(phraseName).description: Remove a phrase from this part, based on the name it was given when it was created.

getPhrase(phraseName).description: Get a phrase from this part, based on the name it was given when it was created. Now you can modify its array.

replaceSequence(phraseName,sequence).description: Find all sequences with the specified name, and replace their patterns with the specified array.

onStep(callback).description: Set the function that will be called at every step. This will clear the previous function.

musicalTimeMode.description: musicalTimeMode uses Tone.Time convention true if string, false if number

maxIterations.description: Set a limit to the number of loops to play. defaults to Infinity

bpm.description: Getters and Setters, setting any paramter will result in a change in the clock's frequency, that will be reflected after the next callback beats per minute (defaults to 60)

timeSignature.description: number of quarter notes in a measure (defaults to 4)

iterations.description: how many times the callback has been called so far

knee([knee],[time]).description: Get current knee or set value w/ time ramp

ratio([ratio],[time]).description: Get current ratio or set value w/ time ramp

threshold(threshold,[time]).description: Get current threshold or set value w/ time ramp

release(release,[time]).description: Get current release or set value w/ time ramp

setInput([unit]).description: Connect a specific device to the p5.SoundRecorder. If no parameter is given, p5.SoundRecorer will record all audible p5.sound from your sketch.

record(soundFile,[duration],[callback]).description: Start recording. To access the recording, provide a p5.SoundFile as the first parameter. The p5.SoundRecorder will send its recording to that p5.SoundFile for playback once recording is complete. Optional parameters include duration ...

saveSound(soundFile,fileName).description: Save a p5.SoundFile as a .wav file. The browser will prompt the user to download the file to their device. For uploading audio to a server, use p5.SoundFile.saveBlob. ...

update(fftObject).description: The update method is run in the draw loop. Accepts an FFT object. You must call .analyze() on the FFT object prior to updating the peakDetect because it relies on a completed FFT analysis.

onPeak(callback,[val]).description: onPeak accepts two arguments: a function to call when a peak is detected. The value of the peak, between 0.0 and 1.0, is passed to the callback.

play(note,[velocity],[secondsFromNow],[s.description: Play tells the MonoSynth to start playing a note. This method schedules the calling of .triggerAttack and .triggerRelease.

triggerAttack(note,[velocity],[secondsFr.description: Trigger the Attack, and Decay portion of the Envelope. Similar to holding down a key on a piano, but it will hold the sustain level until you let go.

triggerRelease(secondsFromNow).description: Trigger the release of the Envelope. This is similar to releasing the key on a piano and letting the sound fade according to the release level and release time.

dispose().description: Get rid of the MonoSynth and free up its resources / memory.

notes.description: An object that holds information about which notes have been played and which notes are currently being played. New notes are added as keys on the fly. While a note has been attacked, but not released, the value of the key is the audiovoice ...

polyvalue.description: A PolySynth must have at least 1 voice, defaults to 8

AudioVoice.description: Monosynth that generates the sound for each note that is triggered. The p5.PolySynth defaults to using the p5.MonoSynth as its voice.

play([note],[velocity],[secondsFromNow],.description: Play a note by triggering noteAttack and noteRelease with sustain time

noteADSR([note],[attackTime],[decayTime].description: noteADSR sets the envelope for a specific note that has just been triggered. Using this method modifies the envelope of whichever audiovoice is being used to play the desired note. The envelope should be reset before noteRelease is ...

setADSR([attackTime],[decayTime],[susRat.description: Set the PolySynths global envelope. This method modifies the envelopes of each monosynth so that all notes are played with this envelope.

noteAttack([note],[velocity],[secondsFro.description: Trigger the Attack, and Decay portion of a MonoSynth. Similar to holding down a key on a piano, but it will hold the sustain level until you let go.

noteRelease([note],[secondsFromNow]).description: Trigger the Release of an AudioVoice note. This is similar to releasing the key on a piano and letting the sound fade according to the release level and release time.
